intro: Amsinckia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy paloverde, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its spiny, leafless stems and is often found in arid and semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Amsinckia hirsuta is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
